message.content:
cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CR

The paper deals with video-based person re-identification, which is a computer vision problem. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper proposes a deep learning architecture that jointly learns spatiotemporal video representations and their similarity metrics, which involves both feature learning and metric learning. This suggests that the paper could also belong to the categories of cs.MM (Multimedia) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper uses an attention mechanism to selectively propagate relevant features and memorize their spatial dependencies, which is a common technique in the field of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper deals with surveillance systems and security, which could also place it in the category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
